&ltOBJECT>.ALLOWCHANGESTATUS() Syntax Result_Flag as L = &ltOBJECT>.ALLOWCHANGESTATUS() Description The &ltOBJECT>.ALLOWCHANGESTATUS() method applies to:
Browses (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltBROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Forms (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltFORM> pointer or the name of the form) The &ltOBJECT>.ALLOWCHANGESTATUS() method returns .T. (TRUE) if the layout allows editing; otherwise, it returns .F. (FALSE). Limitations Desktop applications only. Example dim ptr as P ptr = form.load("Customer Information") ? ptr.AllowChangeStatus() = .T.
See Also Form Functions and Methods, Browse Functions and Methods
